template_id.value: Bed rail and low bed risk assessment

template.concept: Bed rail and low bed risk assessment

term_definitions.items: Encounter Context

Provides extra information about the encounter context, regarding the internal cases used at Pathfinder for encounter types and reasons, along with an appointment and encounter id. Terminology should be loaded from the Think!EHR terminology adapter.
Appointment id
Unique identifier for each appointment process.
Encounter id
Unique identifier for each encounter process.
Encounter type
Type of encounter, should be provided by terminology server.
Encounter reason
Reason for encounter, should be provided by terminology server.
XDS Metadata
Additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
Author specialty
The speciality of the author/composer of the document.
Class code
A high-level document class code, normally selected from a valueset provided by the IHE-XDS Affinity Domain.
For example: Report, Summary, Images, Plan, Patient Preferences, Workflow. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
Document type
The code specifying the precise type of document from the user perspective. Normally selected from a valueset provided by the local IHE-XDS Affinity Domain or national standard.
for example: Pulmonary History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
Confidentiality code
A term specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document.
Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
Health care facility type
A term defining the healthcare facility type.
Coded text is preferred. The codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
Practice setting code
The code specifying the clinical specialty where the act that resulted in the document was performed.
For example: Family Practice, Laboratory, Radiology. Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
Document_media
Additional metadata about the document itself, including size, url.
Event code
This list of codes represents the main clinical acts.
For example: Colonoscopy or appendicectomy.
LRLB risk assessment
bed rails low bed risk assessment
History
@ internal @
Any event
Tree
@ internal @
Initial assessment
Patient is unlikely faller and not requesting bed rails?
Stage 1
Stage 2
Final result
Patient is likely to attempt to get out of bed alone and/or previously attempted whilst bedrails in use
Patient is restless / uncontrolled limb movements / significant confusion (excluding seizures)
Patient is a likely or possible faller but declining bedrail use
Patient has difficulty rolling over in bed - bed rail will assist independence
CVE disruption in spatial / visual awareness. At risk of rolling out bed. Patient unlikely to get out of bed
Patient has requested bed rails or uses bed rails at home
Requires assistance of 1 or more staff to stand
Able to stand without assistance
Bed rail in good condition and detachable rail fitted correctly
Result
Do not use bed rails. Use low bed. Consider floor mats. Consider increased patient supervision.
Do not use bed rails. Do not use low bed. Keep bed on lowest level to allow sit to stand. Consider increased patient supervision.
Use bed rail. Ensure bed rail is in good condition. Consider increased patient supervision.
Bed rail to be used on standard bed. Ensure bed rail is in good condition. Supervision not required.
Patient is unlikely faller - no further assessment is required.
Assessment Date

Tree

Extension
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
